tool.name: ReadMetadata
tool.summary: Reads the metadata in a GeoTIFF header and generates a comprehensive metadata report in HTML or Markdown format.

usage.bullet_item: The tool generates a detailed analysis of TIFF tags, GeoTIFF keys, projection information, and COG validation.
HTML format provides syntax highlighting and is best for viewing in web browsers.
Markdown format is plain text and suitable for documentation systems.
The output file is automatically named based on the input file with the specified suffix and format extension.

P.SPAN: The GeoTIFF file or raster layer to analyze. You can select a layer from the map or browse to a file on disk.
Choose the output format for the metadata report. HTML provides syntax highlighting and is best for viewing, while Markdown is plain text suitable for documentation.
A suffix to append to the output filename before the file extension. Default is '_header'.
The generated metadata report file. This path is automatically determined based on the input file, format, and suffix selections.
When checked, the generated report file will be automatically opened using the system's default application (e.g., a web browser for HTML files).
If checked, an Esri-compatible .aux.xml file containing band statistics and histograms will be created. This allows ArcGIS Pro to skip the 'Calculate Statistics' step when loading the raster.

The Image File Directory (IFD) number to read. Defaults to 0 (the main image). Overviews and other supplemental images are stored in subsequent IFDs. For example, a GeoTIFF with three overviews will have IFDs 0 through 4, where IFD 0 is the main image and IFDs 1-4 are the overviews.
Custom text to display at the top of the report. Useful for classification markings (e.g., CUI, INTERNAL USE ONLY) or project identifiers.
Predefined configuration for report content:
• Analyst (Default):
Focuses on actionable data for geospatial analysis. Includes standard tags, statistics, and compact tables.
• Producer:
Focuses on data production details. Includes all tags (complete scope) and raw text formats.
• Custom:
Allows manual selection of specific report sections below.
Controls the verbosity of the TIFF Tag section:
• Compact:
Shows only common and critical tags. Hides obscure or empty tags.
• Complete:
Lists every single TIFF tag found in the header, including unknown or private tags.
How XML metadata (GDAL_METADATA, GEO_METADATA, PAM, XMP, and external XML files) is presented in the report:
• Table:
Formats XML attributes into a readable table key-value pairs.
• Text:
Displays the raw XML string, useful for copy-pasting or debugging syntax errors.
